WorkItem.Description:
I think it would be a great idea having a State-based navigation that supports not only boolean values but a more dynamic one, that should work much like a collection of conditions and their target (like a collection of Triggers etc.):
Â 
<MultiDataStateBehavior Binding="{Binding IsChecked, ElementName= ShowAsListButton}">
    <State Value="{x:Static local:MyEnum.List}" State="ShowAsList"/>
    <State Value="{x:Static local:MyEnum.Grid}" State="ShowAsGrid"/>
    <State Value="{x:Static local:MyEnum.Icons}" State="ShowAsIcons"/>
</DataStateBehavior>

Comments.Message:
Thats what i want, too. I have several views where the controls are enabled or disabled depending on several states like "Show Data", "Edit Data" and "New Data" - in combination with security rules which defines if a user is allowed to see specific controls (hide-state) or edit the data of a specific control.
Currently i did not find a way to do this with the current implementation of state-based...

Hi,

If I am not mistaken, the DataStateBehavior you are mentioning in this work item is the one provided by Expression Blend. As far as I know Prism does not provide its own implementation of the aforementioned class.

Therefore, as this suggestion involves a change in the functionality of Expression Blend, I believe that it could be proposed in the Expression Blend forums:
 - http://social.expression.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/categories
